aiMainBranchSetup.directive: Initialize ai-pm-org-main branch (done once per project)
aiMainBranchSetup.when: Project initialization or first branch creation

steps.description: Enhanced: Create ai-pm-org-main with remote clone support for team collaboration
steps.priorityLogic: Remote clone > Local restoration > Fresh creation
process: Check if ai-pm-org-main exists locally: git branch --list ai-pm-org-main
If missing locally, check remote: git branch -r --list origin/ai-pm-org-main
PRIORITY 1 - Remote exists: git checkout -b ai-pm-org-main origin/ai-pm-org-main
PRIORITY 2 - No remote but has previous AI state: restore from organizational state
PRIORITY 3 - Completely new: git checkout -b ai-pm-org-main main
Initialize or validate AI organizational structure
Sync database with remote organizational state if cloned
teamCollaborationBenefits: Multiple developers can share AI organizational state
Automatic detection of existing team setup
No manual coordination needed between team members

steps.description: Set up minimal branch tracking in database
process: Initialize ai_instance_branches table
Record ai-pm-org-main as canonical branch
Set up Git state tracking in git_project_state table

branchCreation.directive: Create Git branches for parallel development with automatic user identification

steps.description: Detect if this is a team member joining existing project
detection_criteria: Currently on ai-pm-org-main (team members shouldn't work directly on main)
steps.team_member_behavior: Automatically create work branch for team members

steps.description: Automatically detect user information for branch attribution

user_metadata.name: User identifier for branch attribution
user_metadata.email: Email from Git config if available
user_metadata.detection_source: Track how user was detected (git_config, environment, system, fallback)

steps.conflict_resolution: Sequential numbering prevents conflicts - no additional logic needed

steps.description: ENHANCED: Always clone from ai-pm-org-main (not user's main) for organizational state consistency
steps.criticalPrinciple: Work branches ALWAYS clone from ai-pm-org-main, NOT from user's main
process: Ensure ai-pm-org-main exists (may trigger remote clone for team scenarios)
Switch to ai-pm-org-main first: git checkout ai-pm-org-main
Execute: git checkout -b {branch-name} ai-pm-org-main
Branch inherits complete AI organizational state from canonical branch
Create .ai-pm-meta.json with branch metadata including createdFrom: ai-pm-org-main
whyAlwaysCloneFromAiMain: Organizational State Consistency: All work branches have same starting AI context
Team Collaboration: Multiple developers get consistent organizational state
Theme/Flow Inheritance: Work branches inherit latest AI structure
Database State: Proper AI database state in all work branches

teamCollaborationExample.developerA: git checkout -b ai-pm-org-branch-001 ai-pm-org-main  # Gets full AI state
teamCollaborationExample.developerB: git checkout -b ai-pm-org-branch-002 ai-pm-org-main  # Same AI state as Developer A

steps.description: Register branch in database for tracking

branchIsolation.directive: Git provides natural isolation - no custom logic needed

git_benefits: Each branch has complete independent state

benefits: Zero file copying or database duplication
Familiar Git mental model for users
Multiple branches can work on different approaches independently

identification: Branch creation shows generated sequential number
Branch listing shows number and creation timestamp
Merge operations identify which branch number is being merged

parallelDevelopment.parallelWork: Complete independence through Git branch isolation
